Bivariate Analysis

Aravind Hebbali

2018-01-18

library(blorr)
library(magrittr)

Introduction

blr_bivariate_analysis(hsb2, honcomp, female, prog, race, schtyp)
#>                          Bivariate Analysis                           
#> ---------------------------------------------------------------------
#> Variable    Information Value    LR Chi Square    LR DF    LR p-value 
#> ---------------------------------------------------------------------
#>  female           0.10              3.9350          1        0.0473   
#>   prog            0.44              16.1450         2        3e-04    
#>   race            0.31              11.3694         3        0.0099   
#>  schtyp           0.00              0.0445          1        0.8330   
#> ---------------------------------------------------------------------

Weight of Evidence & Information Value

Introduction

blr_woe_iv(hsb2, prog, honcomp)
#>                          Weight of Evidence                           
#> ---------------------------------------------------------------------
#> levels    0s_count    1s_count    0s_dist    1s_dist      woe     iv  
#> ---------------------------------------------------------------------
#>   1          38          7           0.26       0.13    -0.69    0.09 
#>   2          65          40          0.44       0.75     0.53    0.16 
#>   3          44          6           0.30       0.11    -1.00    0.19 
#> ---------------------------------------------------------------------
#> 
#>       Information Value       
#> -----------------------------
#> Variable    Information Value 
#> -----------------------------
#>   prog            0.44        
#> -----------------------------

Multiple Variables

blr_woe_iv_stats(hsb2, honcomp, prog, race, female, schtyp)
#> Variable: prog
#> 
#>                          Weight of Evidence                           
#> ---------------------------------------------------------------------
#> levels    0s_count    1s_count    0s_dist    1s_dist      woe     iv  
#> ---------------------------------------------------------------------
#>   1          38          7           0.26       0.13    -0.69    0.09 
#>   2          65          40          0.44       0.75     0.53    0.16 
#>   3          44          6           0.30       0.11    -1.00    0.19 
#> ---------------------------------------------------------------------
#> 
#>       Information Value       
#> -----------------------------
#> Variable    Information Value 
#> -----------------------------
#>   prog            0.44        
#> -----------------------------
#> 
#> 
#> Variable: race
#> 
#>                          Weight of Evidence                           
#> ---------------------------------------------------------------------
#> levels    0s_count    1s_count    0s_dist    1s_dist      woe     iv

#>   1          22          2           0.15       0.04    -1.32    0.15 
#>   2          6           5           0.04       0.09     0.81    0.04

Response Distribution by Segments

Introduction

blr_segment_dist(hsb2, honcomp, prog)
#>          Event Segmentation           
#> -------------------------------------
#>   prog       n     1s     n%     1s%  
#> -------------------------------------
#>    1        45     7     0.22    0.04 
#>    2        105    40    0.52    0.20 
#>    3        50     6     0.25    0.03 
#> -------------------------------------

Plot

blr_segment_dist(hsb2, honcomp, prog) %>%
  plot

Response Distribution by Multiple Segments

blr_twoway_segment(hsb2, honcomp, prog, female)
#>                female    
#> -----------------------
#> prog      0       1     
#> -----------------------
#>   1     0.010   0.025   
#> -----------------------
#>   2     0.075   0.125   
#> -----------------------
#>   3     0.005   0.025   
#> -----------------------

Response Distribution

blr_segment(hsb2, honcomp, prog)
#> Event By Attributes 
#> -------------------
#> prog           1s%  
#> -------------------
#>  1             0.04 
#>  2             0.20 
#>  3             0.03 
#> -------------------
